title: Ghirardelli Layered Chocolate Cheesecake With Ganache Glaze
ingredients: 3 cups finely crushed chocolate wafer cookies
4 ounces Ghirardelli® 60% Cacao Bittersweet Chocolate Chips
6 ounces Ghirardelli Semi-Sweet Chocolate Baking Chips
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Stir together cookie crumbs, butter, and sugar until well blended. Press mixture into the bottom and up sides of a 9-inch springform pan coated with cooking spray. 
2. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack, about 30 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 325°F. 
3. Beat cream cheese with a heavy-duty stand mixer until smooth and creamy. Gradually add sugar and flour, beating until smooth. Add eggs and yolks one at a time, beating on low speed just until yellow disappears after each addition. Beat in vanilla. 
4. Divide batter into 2 equal portions. Pour one portion into prepared crust; spread evenly. 
5. Melt chocolate chips in a microwave-safe bowl until smooth. Stir together coffee liqueur and espresso granules until dissolved; mix into the second bowl of cheesecake batter. Stir melted chocolate into the coffee batter. 
6. Gently pour over the plain cheesecake batter in the pan. 
7. Bake for 1 hour and 5 to 15 minutes, until center jiggles slightly. Cool completely for about 2 hours. 
8. Chill covered with foil for 8 to 12 hours. 
9. For the topping, simmer cream and corn syrup, pour over chocolate chips, and whisk until smooth. Cool slightly, pour over cheesecake, and chill until set. Garnish before serving.
